sen.j: 四条家（四條家、しじょうけ）は、羽林家の家格を持つ公家。
sen.e: The Shijo family was a court noble with a family status of the Urin family.
The Shijo family belonged to the court nobility and had a family status of Urin.
sen.cmt: Readability. Also "noble" refers to a single person. It is better to say that the family "belonged to the nobility".
sen.e: The Shijo family belonged to the court nobility and had a family status of Urin.
FUJIWARA no Uona-ryu of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
FUJIWARA no Uona-ryu of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
FUJIWARA no Uona-ryu of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 家業は、料理包丁道・笙。
sen.e: The family business was the ryori hocho-do (cooking and the way of the knife) and the Shinto flute.
The family business was ryori hocho-do (cooking and knives) and the Shinto flute.
sen.cmt: "The way of the knife" is a bit elaborate. I think "knives" is better.
sen.e: The family business was ryori hocho-do (cooking and knives) and the Shinto flute.
The family crest was a water clover.
The family crest was water clover.
The family crest was water clover.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 180 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 180 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 180 koku.
Became the marquess after the Meiji Restoration.
The family was awarded the title of marquess after the Meiji restoration.
sen.cmt: Sentence, needs a subject here, I think.
sen.e: The family was awarded the title of marquess after the Meiji restoration.

sen.j: いわゆる四条流庖丁道の家として知られる。
sen.e: It is known as the family of so-called Shijo-ryu hocho-do (Shijo-ryu cuisine).
It is known as the family of so-called Shijo-ryu hocho-do (Shijo-ryu cuisine).
It is known as the family of so-called Shijo-ryu hocho-do (Shijo-ryu cuisine).

sen.j: 分家に山科家、鷲尾家、西大路家、油小路家、櫛笥家がある。
sen.e: The Yamashina family, the Washinoo/Washio family, the Nishioji family, the Aburanokoji family, and the Kushige family are the branch families.
The Yamashina family, the Washinoo/Washio family, the Nishioji family, the Aburanokoji family, and the Kushige family are branch families of the Shijo family.
sen.cmt: I added "of the Shijo family" for clarity.
sen.e: The Yamashina family, the Washinoo/Washio family, the Nishioji family, the Aburanokoji family, and the Kushige family are branch families of the Shijo family.

sen.j: 藤原房前の子左大臣藤原魚名を祖とする善勝寺流藤原氏の嫡流。
sen.e: The lineage of the eldest son of Zenshoji-ryu (the Zenshoji line), which ancestor was FUJIWARA no Uona, sadaijin (minister of the left), who was the son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
The lineage of the eldest son of Zenshoji-ryu (the Zenshoji line) descended from FUJIWARA no Uona, sadaijin (minister of the left), himself the son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
The lineage of the eldest son of Zenshoji-ryu (the Zenshoji line) descended from FUJIWARA no Uona, sadaijin (minister of the left), himself the son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.

sen.j: 魚名の13代後裔の四条隆季が平安時代末期に四条を名乗る。
sen.e: Takasue SHIJO, the descendant after 13 generations of Uona, identified himself as Shijo.
Takasue SHIJO, the 13th generation of Uona, took the name Shijo at the end of the Heian Era.
sen.cmt: trans 1 is missing "at the end of Heian era". Also changed for more natural English.
sen.e: Takasue SHIJO, the 13th generation of Uona, took the name Shijo at the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 隆季の子四条隆房は鎌倉時代初頭に正二位、権大納言にまで至り、公卿家としての家格を確立した。
sen.e: Takafusa SHIJO, the son of Takasue, had been promoted to Junior Chief of the Councilor of State, shonii (Senior Second Rank), in the beginning of the Kamakura period, and established the family status as the Kugyo family (kugyo means court nobles).

Takafusa SHIJO, the son of Takasue, was promoted to Junior Chief of the Councilor of State, shonii (Senior Second Rank), at the beginning of the Kamakura period, and established the family status of Kugyo (which means "court nobility").
sen.cmt: Changed "had been" to "was" and altered the latter section for clarity.
sen.e: Takafusa SHIJO, the son of Takasue, was promoted to Junior Chief of the Councilor of State, shonii (Senior Second Rank), at the beginning of the Kamakura period, and established the family status of Kugyo (which means "court nobility").

sen.j: 南北朝時代_(日本)には南朝_(日本)の廷臣として活躍した四条隆資が出ている。
sen.e: In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, the family produced Takasue SHIJO, who was active as a courtier of the Southern Court.
In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, the family produced Takasue SHIJO, who was active as a courtier of the Southern Court.
In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, the family produced Takasue SHIJO, who was active as a courtier of the Southern Court.

sen.j: 幕末、明治維新期の四条隆謌（たかうた）は、尊皇攘夷、倒幕派の公卿として国事に奔走し、三条実美らとともに七卿落ちの憂き目にもあったが、明治維新後、復権し陸軍に入り陸軍中将にまで累進した。
sen.e: Takauta SHIJO at the end of Edo period to the Meiji Restoration worked hard for the affairs of the state as a court noble which belonged to the group of reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners/overthrowing of the Tokugawa Shogunate, and faced shichikyo-ochi (defeated seven nobles) with Sanetomi SANJO; however, he gained restitution and joined the army after the Meiji Restoration and was promoted to the lieutenant general.

From the end of Edo period to the Meiji Restoration, Takauta SHIJO was actively involvled in affairs of state as a court noble belonging to the group which revered the Emperor and desired the expulsion of foreigners/overthrow of the Tokugawa Shogunate; he suffered in incident of the shichikyo-ochi (defeated seven nobles) with Sanetomi SANJO, but after the Meiji Restoration he was rehabilitated, joining the army and reaching the rank of lieutenant general.

From the end of Edo period to the Meiji Restoration, Takauta SHIJO was actively involved in affairs of state as a court noble belonging to the group which revered the Emperor and desired the expulsion of foreigners/overthrow of the Tokugawa Shogunate; he suffered in incident of the shichikyo-ochi (defeated seven nobles) with Sanetomi SANJO, but after the Meiji Restoration he was rehabilitated, joining the army and reaching the rank of lieutenant general.

sen.j: 明治17年7月7日侯爵に叙せられる。
sen.e: Received the marquisate on July 7, 1884.
The family received the title of marquess on July 7, 1884.
The family received the title of marquess on July 7, 1884.

sen.j: 隆謌の次の四条隆愛（たかちか）も陸軍に入り、騎兵少佐となる。
sen.e: Takachika SHIJO, the next generation of Takauta, also joined the army and became the cavalry lieutenant commander.
Takachika SHIJO, Takauta's son, also joined the army and became a lieutenant commander in the cavalry.
sen.cmt: "the next generation" is unnatural in this context. I think it is better to just say "Takauta's son".
sen.e: Takachika SHIJO, Takauta's son, also joined the army and became a lieutenant commander in the cavalry.

sen.j: 隆愛の子、四条隆徳（たかのり）は昭和52年（1977年）に死去、現在も直系は健在で日本放送協会でも特番が放送されていた。
sen.e: Takanori SHIJO, the son of Takachika, died in 1977, and its direct line has been alive: Nippon Hoso Kyokai (NHK) featured the family recently.
Takanori SHIJO, the son of Takachika, died in 1977, but the direct Shijo line is still good health, as shown in a recent Nippon Hoso Kyokai (NHK) documentary featuring the family.
Takanori SHIJO, the son of Takachika, died in 1977, but the direct Shijo line is still good health, as shown in a recent Nippon Hoso Kyokai (NHK) documentary featuring the family.

sen.j: 藤原氏一族で直系が健在なのは珍しく、毎年天皇誕生日前日の晩餐会に出席している。
sen.e: It is rare that a direct line of the Fujiwara clan is alive, and the family attends the formal banquet held a day before the Emperor's birthday every year.
It is rare for a direct line of the Fujiwara clan to be maintained to the present day, and the family attends a formal banquet held the day before the Emperor's birthday every year.
It is rare for a direct line of the Fujiwara clan to be maintained to the present day, and the family attends a formal banquet held the day before the Emperor's birthday every year.

sen.j: 分家の四条男爵家に四条流包丁道を受け継いでいる女子がいる。
sen.e: In the branch family of Baron Shijo, there is a female who inherited the Shijo-ryu hocho-do (Shijo-ryu cuisine).
In the branch family of Baron Shijo, there is woman who inherited the Shijo-ryu hocho-do (Shijo-ryu cuisine).
sen.cmt: I am not sure what the point of this sentence is. If the point is that it is rare for the cuisine to be inherited by a woman, then the sentence should have an explanation to this effect.
sen.e: In the branch family of Baron Shijo, there is woman who inherited the Shijo-ryu hocho-do (Shijo-ryu cuisine).

sen.j: 現在、直系長男は第42代四條隆和(たかかず)昭和52年、1977年 生まれ。
sen.e: Currently, the son and the heir of the direct line is Takakazu SHIJO, the 42nd generation of the family, born in 1977.
Currently, the son and the heir of the direct line is Takakazu SHIJO, the 42nd generation of the family, born in 1977.
Currently, the son and the heir of the direct line is Takakazu SHIJO, the 42nd generation of the family, born in 1977.
